description.value: This PlanDefinition profile defines the logic and rules around determining: whether or not data from an encounter is reportable to RESP-NET.

definition.value: This PlanDefinition profile defines the logic and rules around determining: whether or not data from an encounter is reportable to RESP-NET.

description.value: The set of actions that can be used to create plan definition

definition.value: Defines the "startr" action
Description of the start workflow action.

fixedString.value: This action represents the start of the reporting workflow in response to a named event

short.value: Text equivalent of the start workflow action.

definition.value: Text equivalent of the start workflow action.

fixedString.value: Start the reporting workflow in response to a named event

definition.value: The US-PH-PlanDefinition-Action code for the "start" action.

description.value: Triggers can be slided by the named events

definition.value: Use named event names to slice the triggers
Defines the "encounter-close" trigger

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Indicates the types of named events to subscribe to from the EHR.

definition.value: Indicates the types of named events to subscribe to from the EHR.
The name of the event, encounter-close in this case. For any action invoked as a result of this trigger, the triggering encounter is accessible via the context variable `%encounter`
Defines the "encounter-start" trigger

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Indicates the types of named events to subscribe to from the EHR.

definition.value: Indicates the types of named events to subscribe to from the EHR.
The name of the event, encounter-start in this case. For any action invoked as a result of this trigger, the triggering encounter is accessible via the context variable `%encounter`
Defines input data requirements for the action. Required data is accessible via a context variable named `%[id]` using the `id` of the input data requirement
The id of the input requirement, allowing the data to be referenced via a context variable named `%[id]
